alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Brown; Decatur; Jackson; Jennings (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:40AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Decatur, eastern Brown, Bartholomew, Jackson and Jennings Counties through 400 AM EDT... At 239 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Columbus, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Columbus around 255 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include North Vernon and Vernon. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 37 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
